Title.evidence: Title: Randomised Controlled Trial Comparing Endovascular and Open Repair for Descending Thoracic Aortic Aneurysm

Trial_Design.evidence: Randomisation and allocation concealment methods were not applicable as this was a meta-analysis.

Intervention.evidence: This study aimed to evaluate the efficacy of endovascular versus open repair for descending thoracic aortic aneurysm (DTAA).

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to evaluate the efficacy of endovascular versus open repair for descending thoracic aortic aneurysm (DTAA).

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was postoperative mortality, measured over the short-term period.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation and allocation concealment methods were not applicable as this was a meta-analysis.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Endovascular repair was associated with significantly lower postoperative mortality (OR: 0.57, 95% CI: 0.45-0.72) and morbidity.
